japanese:
四葉。
暗いから、足元には注意して歩きなさいよ。
translation:
Yotsuba.
It's dark, so watch your step.

japanese:
うん、わかった。
島に来てからビックリしたけど
街灯がないとこんなに暗いんだねー。
translation:
Okay, got it.
I was surprised when we got to the island,
but it is so dark without streetlights.

japanese:
ちょっと！　懐中電灯を振り回さないで。
しっかり前を照らしてよ。
translation:
Woah! Don't wave the flashlight around.
Shine it in front of you.

japanese: い、一花、もう少しゆっくりと歩いてください。
translation: I-Ichika, please walk a little slower.

japanese:
そんなに震えちゃって。
五月ちゃんはホントに怖がりなんだから。
translation:
Look at you trembling.
You're such a scaredy-cat, Itsuki-chan.

japanese:
上杉さん、クーラーボックス重くないですか？
よかったら私が持ちますよ？
translation:
Uesugi-san, isn't the cooler heavy?
I could carry it for you.

japanese:
はぁはぁ……ふぅ……。
いや、これくらい……大丈夫だ。
浜辺はすぐそこだしな。
translation:
Haah, haah...phew...
No, I can...handle this much.
The beach is right there, too.

japanese: それに、お前はお前で焚き火用の薪を持ってるだろ？
translation:
Besides, you're carrying wood
for the bonfire, aren't you, Yotsuba?

japanese:
あ、そうでした。
でも疲れたら言ってくださいね？
これくらいへっちゃらですから。
translation:
Oh, you're right.
But, if you're tired, please tell me, kay?
I don't mind at all.

japanese: （四葉は本当に体力が有り余ってるな……）
translation: (Yotsuba truly has so much physical strength...)

japanese: なんとか到着したな……。
translation: We've somehow made it...

japanese: おつかれさま、お兄ちゃん。
translation: Good work, big bro.

japanese:
おおおおおー！
上杉さん、見てください！　満天の星ですよ！
translation:
Oooohh!
Uesugi-san, look!
The whole sky is covered in stars!

japanese:
うわ～！
お空がお星さまでいっぱいだ！
translation:
Wooow!
There are so many stars in the sky!

japanese:
本当にいっぱい……。
全部で何個くらいあるんだろう？
translation:
Yeah...
I wonder how many there are in total?

japanese: これは、数えるのはちょっと無理そうだね。
translation: It might be a little impossible to count all these.

japanese:
おじいちゃんの旅館から見た夜空も
綺麗だったけど、それ以上だわ。
translation:
The sky at Grandpa's inn was beautiful,
but this is something else.

japanese:
ええ……。
こんなにたくさんあると、
星が空からこぼれ落ちて降ってきそうです。
translation:
Wow...
With so many stars,
it feels that they'll spill out of the sky.

japanese: あら、ずいぶんと詩的な表現するじゃない。
translation: Oh, how poetic.

japanese: そ、そうですか？
translation: I-is it?

japanese:
ちなみに、あそこで
一番輝いて見えるのが北極星だな。
translation:
By the way, the brightest star you can see over there
is the North Star.

japanese:
北極星はほとんど動かない星だから、
昔は夜の航海の目印として
船乗りたちに重宝されていたんだ。
translation:
The North Star's position is almost fixed in the sky,
so it used to be useful to sailors as a landmark
for night voyages.

japanese: ふーん、北極星ってえらい星なんだ。
translation: Hmm, the North Star sure is great.

japanese:
ということは、北極星を知っていれば
夜道で迷っても安心ですね。
translation:
Which means,
even if you get lost on the road at night, you'll be safe
as long as you know where the North Star is.

japanese:
ああ、その通り！
ちなみに北極星の高度は観測地点の北緯と同じだ。
translation:
Yes, that's right! By the way,
the elevation angle of the North Star
is the same as the latitude of the observation point.

japanese:
そして、ここは南の島だから
俺たちの住んでいる街よりも低緯度となる。
つまり、今見えている北極星は――
translation:
And because this is a small island in the south,
we're at a lower latitude than the city we live in.
In other words, the North Star that we see now%p-2;――

japanese:
普段見ている北極星よりも
少しだけ低い位置に見えていることになる！
どうだ？　地球が丸いことが実感できるだろう！
translation:
%p-2;――%p; is a little lower than the North Star we usually see!
What do you think of that? 
Just realizing that, you can tell the Earth is round!

japanese: なんだ？　どうした？
translation: What? What's wrong?

japanese:
なにもこんなときにまで……。
本当にあなたという人は、そういうところが……。
translation:
Really, Uesugi-kun...
You have to go and talk about that stuff now...?

japanese: なんだ？　何かまずかったか？
translation: What? Did I do something wrong?

japanese:
あなたに知識があることは認めますが、
そういった態度はどうかと思いますよ？
translation:
I admit that you know a lot of things,
but I think you could do something about that attitude.

japanese: ぐっ……。
translation: Oof...

japanese: でも、それがフータローだから。
translation: But that's who Futaro is.

japanese:
フー君らしくていいわ。
おかげで、こういう遊びでも知識があれば
もっと楽しめるんだってわかってきたし。
translation:
It's just like Fu-kun to say that kinda stuff.
I like it. Because of him, I understand that you can
have more fun playing like this if you know your stuff.

japanese:
うん、フータローも、別に勉強させるつもりで
言ってるわけじゃないよね。
translation:
Yes, and Futaro isn't necessarily saying it
to make us study, or anything.

japanese:
……そうですね。
上杉君なりに気を遣ってくれたんですね。
translation:
...You're right.
Uesugi-kun is doing his best for us.
He was probably thinking about us when he said that.

japanese:
（確かに、楽しいかと思って言ったんだが
　ここまでフォローされているのが微妙につらい！
　俺のトークスキル、低すぎだろ！）
translation:
(I did think they would find it interesting.
 But being praised like this feels a bit strange!
 Is my conversational ability really that bad?)

japanese: それで、流星群は何時頃に始まるのですか？
translation: So, when can we see the meteor shower?

japanese: さあな？
translation: I wonder...

japanese:
こんなときだからだ。
ここまで見事な星空を見る機会なんて
もうないかもしれないんだぞ。
translation:
It's especially at times like this.
You may never get another chance
to see such a spectacular starry sky.

japanese:
知識を身につけるのには実践も必要だ。
それに、知っていれば面白いだろ？
translation:
Applying what you've learned requires practice.
Besides, it's interesting to know, right?

japanese:
まあ面白いけど、今はできればもうちょっと
ロマンチックな話が聞きたいかな。
translation:
Well, it IS interesting, but right now,
I'd like to hear something a little more romantic.

japanese:
ロマンならあるだろ！
地球が丸いなんてスペクタクルな発見を
追体験できるんだ！
translation:
There's a TON of romance!
You can relive the spectacular discovery
that the Earth is round!

japanese:
ですねー、昔の人はビックリしたでしょうね。
大地が丸くてしかも回ってるなんて。
translation:
That's right, people in the past
must have been surprised. The Earth being round
and that it spins, of all things.

japanese:
フータロー君にロマンチックを期待したのが
間違いだったか。
translation:
It was a mistake to hope Futaro-kun
had a romantic side to him.

japanese: ええ、そうですね。
translation: Yes, indeed so.

japanese: それで、流星群は何時頃に始まるのですか？
translation: So, when can we see the meteor shower?

japanese: さあな？
translation: I wonder...

japanese:
望遠鏡があればよかったんだが。
観察しながらもっと詳しく説明してやれたのにな。
残念だ。
translation:
Wish we had a telescope.
If we could observe it, I could explain things
in more detail. It's a shame.

japanese:
えっ……？
いえ、そういうことではなくてですね。
translation:
Huh...?
No, that's not what I'm talking about.

japanese: フータロー、望遠鏡使えるの？
translation: Futaro, can you use a telescope?

japanese:
特に難しいものじゃないぞ。
興味があるなら今度、覗いてみればいい。
translation:
It's not that hard.
If you're interested, 
you should take a look next chance you get.

japanese: 破軍星とか見れるかな？
translation: Can we see the Alkaid star and the like?

japanese:
ほほう、ここで破軍星とはさすが三玖だな。
ああ、ばっちり見えるはずだ。
translation:
Woah, nice one, Miku. Of course you'd know Alkaid.
Yes, you should be able to see it clearly.

japanese:
ちょっと待って。
はぐ……ってなに？
translation:
Hold on a second.
What is Alka...?

japanese:
北斗七星のアルカイドのことだ。
簡単に言うと、中国では破軍と呼ばれていて
戦事にまつわる伝説がある星だな。
translation:
It's a star in the Big Dipper, to put it simply.
In China, it's called the Jade Light.
There are many legends about it in history.

japanese: そうなのですか……。
translation: Is that so...?

japanese:
なるほどねー、そういうことを知ってると
星の観察もより面白くなりそう。
translation:
I see, if you know stuff like that,
observing stars will be even more fun.

japanese:
だろう！
もっと楽しめるように色々と解説してやるぞ！
translation:
Right?
I'll just keep on explaining things, then,
so you'll have more fun!

japanese:
……ありがとうございます。
ですが、お手柔らかにお願いしますね。
translation:
...Thank you very much.
But please go easy on us.

japanese: それで、流星群は何時頃に始まるのですか？
translation: So, when can we see the meteor shower?

japanese: さあな？
translation: I wonder...

japanese: ええっ！？
translation: WHAAA?!

japanese:
この時期に流星群を眼視観測できるのは確かだ。
ただ、さすがに正確な時間まではわからん。
待つしかない。
translation:
I'm sure that the meteor showers were able to be
observed around this time.
However, I don't know the exact time. We can only wait.

japanese: そんな……。
translation: No way...

japanese: ものすごくガッカリしてる！？
translation: Why is she so disappointed?!

japanese:
五月ちゃん、流星群見るの楽しみにしてたから。
でも夜はまだ始まったばかりなんだし、
諦めるのは早いよね？
translation:
Itsuki-chan was looking forward
to seeing the meteor shower, but the night has
only just begun. It's too early to give up now, right?

japanese:
ああ、それに……
俺は見れると思ったから、お前たちに提案したんだ。
translation:
Yes, and...
I thought we'd be able see it,
so I suggested it to all of you.

japanese:
ほら五月、落ち込んでないで
レジャーシート広げるの手伝って。
それとも砂の上に座るつもり？
translation:
Look, Itsuki, don't be all sad.
Help me spread the picnic blanket.
Or, would you rather sit on the sand?

japanese: はい……。
translation: Okay...

japanese:
あのあたり、平らで座りやすそう。
こっちのシートも広げておくね。
translation:
It looks pretty flat over there, so we can sit.
I'll spread the blanket out.

japanese:
じゃあ、私は焚き火の準備をしますね。
真っ暗だとさすがに危ないですから。
translation:
Okay then, I'll prepare the bonfire.
It's dangerous with it being pitch-black like this.

japanese: おう、火の扱いには気をつけろよ。
translation: Right, be careful with the fire.

japanese: この程度の灯りなら、星を見るのにも影響ないな。
translation:
This level of light won't affect our ability
to see the stars.

japanese: 流星群、みんなで見れるといいね。
translation: I hope we can all see the meteor shower.

japanese:
大丈夫ですよ。
いざとなったら上杉さんがなんとかしてくれます！
translation:
It'll be alright.
Uesugi-san will do something about it!

japanese:
とんだ無茶振りを……俺は神様じゃねーぞ？
願い事はそれこそ流れ星にするもんだろ。
translation:
Don't be absurd... I'm not a god, you know?
Make your wishes on the shooting stars.

japanese:
（けど、見せてやりたいよな。
　らいはにも……こいつらにも……）
translation:
(Though, if I can, 
 I'd like to show them the meteor shower.
 For Raiha...and the girls...)

japanese: あっ……。
translation: Ah...

japanese: おお……！
translation: Ohhh...!

japanese:
す、すごいっ！　すごいよ！！
流れ星があんなにいっぱい……
これがお兄ちゃんの言ってた流星群？
translation:
A-amazing! AMAZING!!
For there to be THAT many shooting stars... Is this
the meteor shower you were talking about, big bro?

japanese:
あ、ああ、そうだぞらいは！
どうだ、すごいだろ！？
translation:
Y-yeah, that's right, Raiha!
What do you think? Isn't it amazing?!

japanese:
うんっ！！
みんな、流星群始まったよー！
translation:
YEAH!!
Everyone, the meteor shower's started!

japanese: さっきまで静かだった星空が一瞬で……。
translation: The starry sky was so still a moment ago...

japanese:
すごい……こんなの見たことない。
まるで光のシャワーを浴びてるみたい……。
translation:
Amazing... I've never seen anything like this.
It's like we're being bathed
in a shower of light...

japanese:
うん……綺麗だね。
ホント……目が離せないよ……。
translation:
Yes...it is beautiful.
I really can't...take my eyes off of it...

japanese:
本当に始まりました……。
こんなにも素敵な光景を、
全員揃って一緒に見られるなんて……。
translation:
It really has started, huh...
It's such a wonderful sight. I can't believe
that we can see it together like this...

japanese:
俺は見れると思ったから、お前たちに提案したんだ。
そう言っただろ？
translation:
I thought we'd be able to see it.
That's why I made the suggestion, you know?

japanese: はい……。
translation: Yeah...

japanese:
どうしよう四葉さん！
考えておいたお願い事、もう全部言っちゃった！
translation:
What should I do, Yotsuba-san?!
I've already said all of the wishes I could think of!

japanese:
こうなったら、思いついた順に
全部お願いしちゃいましょう！
遠慮はいりませんよー！
translation:
In that case, wish for anything and everything
that you can think of whenever you think of it!
Don't hold back!

japanese: （すっかりはしゃいでるな、あいつら）
translation: (They're really enjoying themselves, aren't they?)
